tool.name: qiime2 quality-control evaluate-composition
tool.description: Evaluate expected vs. observed taxonomic composition of samples

param.name: depth
param.label: depth: Int
param.help: [default: 7] Maximum depth of semicolon-delimited taxonomic ranks to test (e.g., 1 = root, 7 = species for the greengenes reference sequence database).

param.name: palette
param.label: palette: Str % Choices('Set1', 'Set2', 'Set3', 'Pastel1', 'Pastel2', 'Paired', 'Accent', 'Dark2', 'tab10', 'tab20', 'tab20b', 'tab20c', 'viridis', 'plasma', 'inferno', 'magma', 'terrain', 'rainbow')
param.help: [default: 'Set1'] Color palette to utilize for plotting.

param.name: plot_tar
param.label: plot_tar: Bool
param.help: [default: Yes] Plot taxon accuracy rate (TAR) on score plot. TAR is the number of true positive features divided by the total number of observed features (TAR = true positives / (true positives + false positives)).

param.name: plot_tdr
param.label: plot_tdr: Bool
param.help: [default: Yes] Plot taxon detection rate (TDR) on score plot. TDR is the number of true positive features divided by the total number of expected features (TDR = true positives / (true positives + false negatives)).

param.name: plot_r_value
param.label: plot_r_value: Bool
param.help: [default: No] Plot expected vs. observed linear regression r value on score plot.

param.name: plot_r_squared
param.label: plot_r_squared: Bool
param.help: [default: Yes] Plot expected vs. observed linear regression r-squared value on score plot.

param.name: plot_bray_curtis
param.label: plot_bray_curtis: Bool
param.help: [default: No] Plot expected vs. observed Bray-Curtis dissimilarity scores on score plot.

param.name: plot_jaccard
param.label: plot_jaccard: Bool
param.help: [default: No] Plot expected vs. observed Jaccard distances scores on score plot.

param.name: plot_observed_features
param.label: plot_observed_features: Bool
param.help: [default: No] Plot observed features count on score plot.

param.name: plot_observed_features_ratio
param.label: plot_observed_features_ratio: Bool
param.help: [default: Yes] Plot ratio of observed:expected features on score plot.

param.name: type
param.label: metadata: MetadataColumn[Categorical]
param.help: [optional] Optional sample metadata that maps observed_features sample IDs to expected_features sample IDs.

validator.message: The first column cannot be selected (they are IDs).

tool.help:
QIIME 2: quality-control evaluate-composition ============================================= Evaluate expected vs. observed taxonomic composition of samples
Outputs: -------- :visualization.qzv: <no description>
|
Description: ------------ This visualizer compares the feature composition of pairs of observed and expected samples containing the same sample ID in two separate feature tables. Typically, feature composition will consist of taxonomy classifications or other semicolon-delimited feature annotations. Taxon accuracy rate, taxon detection rate, and linear regression scores between expected and observed observations are calculated at each semicolon-delimited rank, and plots of per-level accuracy and observation correlations are plotted. A histogram of distance between false positive observations and the nearest expected feature is also generated, where distance equals the number of rank differences between the observed feature and the nearest common lineage in the expected feature. This visualizer is most suitable for testing per-run data quality on sequencing runs that contain mock communities or other samples with known composition. Also suitable for sanity checks of bioinformatics pipeline performance.
|
